Pizac, The Associated Press), 90741=Cleveland Cavaliers’ LeBron James, top, shoots over New York Knicks’ Jose Calderon during the first half of an NBA basketball game, Sunday, Feb. 22, 2015, in New York. (Seth Wenig, The Associated Press), 41306=When: Russell Westbrook’s performance in the evaluation period of Feb. 21-27 was off the charts. Three consecutive triple-doubles earned him The Denver Post’s NBA player of the week award., 91113=With about 10:30 remaining in the first quarter of the Cavaliers’ win against the Knicks in New York on Sunday, James scored off a layup that moved him ahead of former Nugget Allen Iverson on the league’s all-time scoring list., 129879=But more telling, perhaps, were his comments about the 2003 sexual assault case in Colorado, an incident that will always be a part of his legacy, even though the charges were dropped. Bryant had sex with a woman in Edwards, near where he was to undergo knee surgery by Dr. Richard Steadman. The woman accused Bryant of raping her in his hotel room at The Lodge & Spa at Cordillera, but the case was dropped after she refused to testify. A civil suit was later settled and Bryant publicly apologized, but admitted no guilt., 47460=In 1947, the New York Knicks drafted 23-year-old Japanese-American guard Wat Misaka from the University of Utah in the Basketball Association of America draft. The BAA would merge with the National Basketball League in 1949 to form the NBA., 116345=Arrival Acquired from Washington as part of a three-team trade with the Clippers on March 15, 2012., 59132=Eric Bledsoe of the Phoenix Suns and Jusuf Nurkic of the Denver Nuggets vie for a tip off at Pepsi Center on Feb. 25, 2015 in Denver. (Doug Pensinger, Getty Images), 97225=Andre Miller (22) of the Sacramento Kings drives past Marcus Smart (36) of the Boston Celtics in the fourth quarter at Sleep Train Arena on February 20, 2015 in Sacramento, Calif. (Thearon W. Henderson, Getty Images), 129390=“I know who I am,” he told Chuck Klosterman in an extensive interview for GQ’s March issue., 48654=Since the day he was cut in the fall of 1947, Misaka had not been back to New York, much less the Garden, but on Monday, he returned. In the hallway leading to the dressing room, he was shown plaques for every Knicks team, and there on the 1947-48 plaque was his name., 48357=In 2009, Misaka returned to the Garden for the first time since he was cut. In an interview with The New York Times that day, he admired a plaque that had his name on it., 41526=What’s up: In a packed week of five games in seven nights, Westbrook showed no signs of wear, averaging a triple-double of 30.6 points, 11.8 assists and 10.6 rebounds. An incredible week completed an amazing February for the former UCLA star, who averaged 31.2 points, 10.3 assists and 9.1 rebounds in 12 games. He became the second player in NBA history to average 30-10-9 in a calendar month. The first? Oscar Robertson., 14378=— Paul George (@Yg_Trece) March 4, 2015, 27360=— Scott Agness (@ScottAgness) March 3, 2015, 47099=Earl Lloyd, who became the first black player in NBA history in 1950, died Thursday at the age of 86. A legend and a pioneer in the game of basketball, but did you know that he was actually the second non-Caucasian person to play in the league?, 76911=The procedure will be Rose’s third knee surgery in four years: He tore the anterior cruciate ligament in his left knee at the start of the 2011 playoffs, missed all of the subsequent season to recover, returned in 2013 only to tear the meniscus in his right knee 10 games in, and could now miss the remainder of this season to have that same ligament repaired once more., 78390=— John Wall (@JohnWall) February 25, 2015, 91741=While the achievement is just one of many in James’s career, it probably holds more meaning than others. In 2013, he raved about Iverson in multiple interviews with ESPN, telling Tom Haberstroh that Iverson is “Pound-for-pound, probably the greatest player who ever played., 77296=Rose has helped the Bulls to the No. 3 spot in the East this season, averaging 18.4 points on 40.7 percent shooting from the field with 5.0 assists in 46 games — his best numbers since the lockout-shortened 2011-12 season., 53723=Nuggets guard Ty Lawson, during the team’s home loss to Charlotte on Jan. 31. (AP Photo/David Zalubowski), 79105=— Jordan Crawford (@jcraw55) February 25, 2015, 98358=Background: Miller has always been the player Karl could agree on. Karl sulked in 2006 when the Nuggets dealt Miller to Philadelphia as part of the Allen Iverson trade. Karl celebrated in 2011 when Miller was reacquired by Denver., 116615=Contract Signed a four-year, $44 million extension on July 18, 2012., 78753=— DeAndre Jordan (@deandrejordan6) February 25, 2015, 84456=Jarrett Jack #0 of the Brooklyn Nets is pressured by the New York Knicks at the Barclays Center on Feb. 6, 2015 in Brooklyn. (Elsa, Getty Images), 116850=The year-by-year breakdown: 2012-13: $10 million 2013-14: $10.75 million 2014-15: $11.25 million 2015-16: $12 million, 48206=Misaka’s professional career was brief, scoring just seven points in three games for the Knicks in the 1947-48 season before being cut., 78021=— LeBron James (@KingJames) February 25, 2015, 47715=The 5-foot-7 Misaka had already established himself as a star at Madison Square Garden in college. In 1944, he helped the Utes win the NCAA championship in the arena. But it was three years later in the 1947 NIT championship game where Misaka’s play left a resonating impact with New York fans., 27819=— Scott Agness (@ScottAgness) March 3, 2015, 117330=Departure Traded to Philadelphia, along with a future first-round pick, to Philadelphia on Feb. 19, 2015. The Nuggets got an $11.25 million trade exception in the deal and unloaded the $12 million remaining on the final year of the four-year contract he signed in 2012.}
textBeforeTable: Total wins Here’s a look at how Brian Shaw stacks up against the other coaches in Denver Nuggets history . (Numbers include NBA and ABA records): The Denver Nuggets fired head coach Brian Shaw on Tuesday. Shaw compiled a record of 56-85 in his two seasons at the helm, giving him both the 10th-most win total in team history. Nuggets coach Brian Shaw steamed at a call late in the game he thought should have gone the Nuggets way.
